benchmark_details.name: Ambiguous Speech Dataset for Robotics
benchmark_details.overview: We present the first ambiguous speech dataset for robotics, designed to advance research in speech disambiguation, consisting of 1,540 ambiguous utterances.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To improve the understanding and execution of ambiguous spoken language instructions by robots through the use of prosodic features.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The dataset is limited in size (1,540 samples) and participant diversity, which may affect generalizability.

data.source: Collected from 22 participants recording ambiguous instructions.
data.annotation: Manually annotated by participants for referent intents.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated comparing predicted intent labels against the ground truth labels.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better disambiguation of ambiguous speech instructions.
methodology.validation: Training and evaluation sets are split to ensure no overlap between training and testing data.
